intro: Erigeron spathulatus, commonly known as the spoonleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky areas. It produces showy white or pale yellow flowers with prominent central disks. Its leaves are spoon-shaped, hence the common name, and it is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value.
